Package gui

Class ReliableRobot

java.lang.Object
gui.ReliableRobot
All Implemented Interfaces:
Robot
Direct Known Subclasses:
UnreliableRobot
public class ReliableRobot extends Object implements Robot
Author:
Alex Longo Class: ReliableRobot Responsibilities: Transfer information from sensors to RobotDriver, perform commands from RobotDriver by using actuators through Control. Keep track of battery life, handle battery consumption and failure. Collaborators: Wizard, WallFollower, ReliableSensor, UnreliableSensor, Control

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface gui.Robot

    Robot.Direction, Robot.Turn

  • Method Details

    • setController

      public void setController​(Control controller)
      This method provides the ReliableRobot with a reference to the controller to cooperate with. The ReliableRobot memorizes the controller such that this method is most likely called only once and for initialization purposes. The controller serves as the main source of information for the ReliableRobot about the current position, the presence of walls, the reaching of an exit. The controller is assumed to be in the playing state.
      Specified by:
      setController in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      controller - is the communication partner for ReliableRobot
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if controller is null, or if controller is not in playing state, or if controller does not have a maze

    • addDistanceSensor

      public void addDistanceSensor​(DistanceSensor sensor, Robot.Direction mountedDirection)
      This method adds a distance sensor to the ReliableRobot such that it measures in the given direction. This method is used when a ReliableRobot is initially configured to get ready for operation.
      Specified by:
      addDistanceSensor in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      sensor - is the distance sensor to be added
      mountedDirection - is the direction that it points to relative to the ReliableRobot's forward direction

    • getCurrentPosition

      public int[] getCurrentPosition() throws Exception
      This method provides the current position as (x,y) coordinates for the maze as an array of length 2 with [x,y].
      Specified by:
      getCurrentPosition in interface Robot
      Returns:
      array of length 2, x = array[0], y = array[1]
      Throws:
      Exception - if position is outside of the maze

      Returns:
      cardinal direction is the ReliableRobot's current direction in absolute terms

    • move

      public void move​(int distance)
      This method moves ReliableRobot forward a given number of steps. A step matches a single cell.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      distance - is the number of cells to move in the robot's current forward direction
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if distance not positive

    • jump

      public void jump()
      This method makes ReliableRobot move in a forward direction even if there is a wall in front of it. This makes ReliableRobot jump over the wall if necessary. The distance is always 1 step and the direction is always forward. If the ReliableRobot tries to jump over an exterior wall and would land outside of the maze that way, it remains at its current location and direction, hasStopped() == true as this is not supposed to happen.
      Specified by:
      jump in interface Robot

    • isAtExit

      public boolean isAtExit()
      This method tells if the current position is right at the exit but still inside the maze.
      Specified by:
      isAtExit in interface Robot
      Returns:
      true if robot is at the exit, false otherwise

    • isInsideRoom

      public boolean isInsideRoom()
      This method tells if current position is inside a room.
      Specified by:
      isInsideRoom in interface Robot
      Returns:
      true if robot is inside a room, false otherwise

    • hasStopped

      public boolean hasStopped()
      This method tells if ReliableRobot has stopped for reasons like lack of energy, hitting an obstacle, etc.
      Specified by:
      hasStopped in interface Robot
      Returns:
      true if the robot has stopped, false otherwise

    • distanceToObstacle

      public int distanceToObstacle​(Robot.Direction direction) throws UnsupportedOperationException
      This method tells the distance to an obstacle (a wall) in the given direction. The direction is relative to the robot's current forward direction. Distance is measured in the number of cells towards that obstacle The ReliableRobot uses its internal DistanceSensor objects for this and delegates the computation to the DistanceSensor in the correct direction
      Specified by:
      distanceToObstacle in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      direction - specifies the direction of interest
      Returns:
      number of steps towards obstacle if obstacle is visible in a straight line of sight, Integer.MAX_VALUE otherwise
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if ReliableRobot has no sensor in this direction or the sensor exists but is currently not operational
      Exception - thrown if robot stopped due to some problem, e.g. lack of energy

    • canSeeThroughTheExitIntoEternity

      public boolean canSeeThroughTheExitIntoEternity​(Robot.Direction direction) throws UnsupportedOperationException
      This method tells if a sensor can identify the exit in the given direction relative to the ReliableRobot's current forward direction from the current position.
      Specified by:
      canSeeThroughTheExitIntoEternity in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      direction - is the direction of the sensor
      Returns:
      true if the exit of the maze is visible in a straight line of sight
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if ReliableRobot has no sensor in this direction or the sensor exists but is currently not operational

      Helper method that sets private boolean flag stopped

      public void startFailureAndRepairProcess​(Robot.Direction direction, int meanTimeBetweenFailures, int meanTimeToRepair) throws UnsupportedOperationException
      PROJECT 4 METHOD
      Specified by:
      startFailureAndRepairProcess in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction the sensor is mounted on the robot
      meanTimeBetweenFailures - is the mean time in seconds, must be greater than zero
      meanTimeToRepair - is the mean time in seconds, must be greater than zero
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if method not supported
